poem:
### Morning Headlines

In the shadow of the nation's Capitol,  
a gunshot cracks the dawn—  
Elias, with his pockets full of rage,  
sends two lives spiraling  
into the quiet of autumn air.  
And yet, we gather around  
our breakfast tables,  
the chatter of spoons against cups,  
numb to a world splintering  
beyond the page.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Shooting of Israeli embassy staffers underscores US ‘era of violent populism’ The killing of two staff of the Israeli embassy in Washington DC comes as the war in Gaza has splintered the American body politic alongside the ongoing rise in political violence. A shooter, identified as Elias Rodriguez, shot the two people, Yaron Lischinsky and Sarah Milgrim, outside the Capital Jewish Museum on Wednesday after they left an event hosted by the American Jewish Committee.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Shooting of Israeli embassy staffers underscores US ‘era of violent populism’ The killing of two staff of the Israeli embassy in Washington DC comes as the war in Gaza has splintered the American body politic alongside the ongoing rise in political violence. A shooter, identified as Elias Rodriguez, shot the two people, Yaron Lischinsky and Sarah Milgrim, outside the Capital Jewish Museum on Wednesday after they left an event hosted by the American Jewish Committee.
